channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 2024 St Patricks Day
item.description:
Sunday, March 17, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to celebrate 2024 St Patricks Day.

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
item.xCal:location: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha

item.title: Track National Championships
item.description:
Monday, March 18, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to celebrate the Track National Championships.

The Track National Championships are the biggest domestic track event in the country. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like to show support for the Australian team by lighting city assets green and gold.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Oceania Cycling Championships
item.description:
Tuesday, March 19, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and White to celebrate the Oceania Cycling Championships.

The Oceania Cycling Championships is a collection of cycling competitions across several cycling disciplines held annually to determine the Oceania champion in each respective discipline. These disciplines include Gran Fondo, Track, Mountain Bike, BMX Freestyle and BMX Racing. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like to support this event by lighting city assets in blue and white.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: World Science Festival and CurioCity
item.description:
Wednesday, March 20, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate World Science Festival and CurioCity.

Queensland Museum Network will once again be hosting World Science Festival including Curiocity. The only global extension of this hugely popular initiative, World Science Festival Brisbane reinforces Queensland Museum’s position as a leader in Science,  Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) education and engagement. World Science Festival Brisbane celebrates the entanglement of science and art through a curated program of thought-provoking conversations, inspiring theatrical and cinematic experiences, interactive workshops and engaging demonstrations. Curiocity Brisbane sparks inspiration and innovation, transforming our city into an interactive place to 'explore, create and play'. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like support the joint event through activating red city lighting across Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Harmony Day
item.description:
Thursday, March 21, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Harmony Day.

Harmony Day is celebrated annually on 21 March in Australia. Harmony Day began in 1999, coinciding with the United Nations International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination. The message of Harmony Day is social cohesion and racial harmony, and it is expressed through community participation, inclusiveness, celebrating diversity, respect and belonging.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Make March Purple
item.description:
Friday, March 22, 2024

The Tropical Dome will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple.

Make March Purple is an Australia wide campaign supported by epilepsy organisations across the country and the national peak body, Epilepsy Australia. Make March Purple for epilepsy campaign helps create a community that is aware of epilepsy, breaking down barriers for people living with the condition. World Purple Day, held on March 26 is an international day of awareness in support of 50 million people living with epilepsy. https://myimpact.epilepsyqueensland.com.au/make-march-purple

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Dance for Daniel
item.description:
Saturday, March 23, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red to support Dance for Daniel.

City Hall will be lit Red for the Daniel Morcombe Foundation event ‘Dance for Daniel’. The Dance for Daniel is the Daniel Morcombe Foundation's key fundraising event and is a night of celebration of the achievements of the Foundation and the wider child safety sector. The 2024 event marks the 19th Annual Dance. The night represents a gathering of supporters, corporate partners, VIPs and Foundation committee.

This Light Up is organised by: Daniel Morcombe Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Earth Hour
item.description:
Saturday, March 23, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and No Lights 8:30 to 9:30pm to support Earth Hour.

Earth Hour is an annual movement for the environment that started right here in Australia in 2007, and has since grown to become the world's largest movement to protect our planet. Every year hundreds of millions of people around the world take part in Earth Hour. For 60 minutes people in more than 7,000 cities in over 190 countries switch off their lights as a symbolic gesture of solidarity to show they care about our planet and its future. Earth Hour isn't just about switching off your lights. Our aim is to spark global conversations on the impacts of climate change and inspire positive action to protect our natural world. By working together we can help shape a bright future for us all. This year, Earth Hour is at 8:30pm local time Saturday 23 March, 2024. We're inviting all Australians to sign up and join the global community of millions supporting stronger action on climate change. Visit www.earthhour.org.au to get involved!

This Light Up is organised by: WWF Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World TB Day
item.description:
Sunday, March 24, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World TB Day.

World TB Day and the Light Up Red campaign raise awareness for Tuberculosis, the 'silent pandemic'. Every year, 10 million people fall ill with TB. Despite being a preventable and curable disease, 1.5 million people die from TB each year, making it the world’s top infectious killer.

This Light Up is organised by: Results Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Make March Purple
item.description:
Monday, March 25, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple.

Make March Purple is an Australia wide campaign supported by epilepsy organisations across the country and the national peak body, Epilepsy Australia. Make March Purple for epilepsy campaign helps create a community that is aware of epilepsy, breaking down barriers for people living with the condition. World Purple Day, held on March 26 is an international day of awareness in support of 50 million people living with epilepsy. https://myimpact.epilepsyqueensland.com.au/make-march-purple

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Make March Purple for epilepsy campaign helps create a community that is aware of epilepsy, breaking down barriers for people living with the condition. World Purple Day, held on March 26 is an international day of awareness in support of 50 million people living with epilepsy. https://myimpact.epilepsyqueensland.com.au/make-march-purple

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Oceania Cycling Championships
item.description:
Friday, March 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate the Oceania Cycling Championships.

The Oceania Cycling Championships is a collection of cycling competitions across several cycling disciplines held annually to determine the Oceania champion in each respective discipline. These disciplines include Gran Fondo, Track, Mountain Bike, BMX Freestyle and BMX Racing. Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like to support this event by lighting city assets in blue and white.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Trans Day of Visiblity
item.description:
Sunday, March 31, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit White to support Trans Day of Visiblity.

Trans Day of Visibility (TDOV) is an annual international celebration of trans pride and awareness, that is dedicated to celebrating Transgender and Gender Diverse communities and raising awareness of the stigma and discrimination faced. In addition to this, the purpose of the day is also to celebrate our communities by being visible and proud.

This Light Up is organised by: Qld Aids Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
